text: when I was a kid I remember going to a
tech conference saw an evangelist
teaching technology and when I
approached them and talked to them at
that point I realized that's what I want
to do hi my name is Patrick I guess for
me I've always thought of myself as a
jack-of-all-trades I've been through a
variety of different roles originally as
a support engineer worked with a lot of
cool cases one of my favorite is with
Netflix and afterwards I wanted to
expand so today I'm now a technical
trainer love doing this job day to day
it's between two things either teaching
a class studying for a class it's really
the preparation to teach with these
classes that is more important what do I
add on top of that how do I make that
class special or how do I make it more
enjoyable for the customer one of the
coolest stories I had was actually from
our recent summit a student came up to
me and talked about how he took one of
my classes and got certified he was
working 50 years in the IT industry
working on really old technology and he
didn't think that he could reinvent and
rescale it learn this new technology
through the classes he was able to learn
about the cloud past the certification
and from that he actually got a new job
got higher pay today and he's also
helping of his friends go through the
same process as well so it's really cool
to see someone that has been in industry
so long reinvent himself that I get to
travel the world and I get to teach
about technology and if I can teach
larger groups kids in stem technology's
really big thing for me so I hope that
getting certified will help me go
towards an ethical everybody on the
training team has something different to
bring to the table one of them used to
be a DJ another one was a world-class
bartender just kind of being a trainer
means that you love to learn outside of
all of us everybody has different things
that they're really good
so it's always something to learn from
everyone else
